Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...Uh. Please stop, guys. Those,.. those are chrome plated lugs.

Speaker: teen
Dialogue: Yo, Driver, you got any Bang in this whip?!

Speaker: other teen
Dialogue: `Bitch is deaf.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Back to work, old man.

Speaker: old lady
Dialogue: Shouldn't we lock the doors?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: They're locked, ma'am.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Logan.

Speaker: hispanic woman
Dialogue: ...I knew it was you.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Don't we all.

Speaker: hispanic woman
Dialogue: What the hell happened to you?! What are you hiding from?!

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: As I live and breathe. The Wolverine. And he's a junkie now.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Who the fuck are you?

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Y'know, you got some buckshot in your door.  I heard you were in Phoenix. Food's better there by the way. But then, last night, some friends in Texas H-P called, told me they found three dead cholos in a pullout out on 54. Not unusual, except one was missing a hand. Another a leg. Multiple parallel lacerations. Slashes, femoral, thoracic. So, they're thinking it was either an escaped Tiger or Freddy Krueger... but neither of those can drive, one being fictional the other extinct. And since the wheel lugs they found belong to a `24 Gauntlet--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Get out. Now.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Has she found you yet? ...Gabriela?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I don't know any Gabriela. So get the fuck out.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: I know what you're hiding, amigo. Cue ball south of the border?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: A little ...cooperation.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Mr. Espiranza, yes, I know I said June, but I want the boat now. Yes. Why does that mean the price go up?

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: He's having a bad day.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: They're all bad days.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: He needed these six hours ago. This is not enough, you know. It won't last through the week.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'm working on it.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Your turn.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: He's not talking with anybody.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Don't be so sure. He had all these details. I thought that tank was supposed to provide some sort of barrier. It's got all these cracks in it. What good is that?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Please stop.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: He's been asking questions again. He's trying to read my mind.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: That's what these are for.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Friends, I have Good News today! It's not about what you do. It's not about your deeds. You can't live up to his rules. God knows you can't. That's OK! We're imperfect!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: The new Quesalupa from Taco Bell. Get it with chicken, get it with steak. But with cheese baked right in the shell it's the next big--  Who are you?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You know who I am.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: The man who puts me to sleep.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We could both use some sleep.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: What are you fucking doing to me!?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: How long have I been here?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You remember what they are. The shots mellow the seizures, the pills keep them from happening.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Fuck off, Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: So you know who I am now.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I always know who you are. Sometimes I just don't recognize you.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Take the pills.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...you leave me alone with that fucking Albino... he won't listen to me. I know a damn speciation when I see one.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: A speciation.  A new mutant. A young one. There are forces trying to kill them! They need help!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Too bad you're not in that business anymore.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: They want your help, not mine.  Oh, yes. That's how fucking stupid they are. They're waiting for you. At the Statue of Liberty.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: The Statue of Liberty was a long time ago, Charles. A long time.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Impossible.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You always thought we were part of God's Plan. Maybe we were just God's mistake.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: What a disappointment you are.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'm not in the mood for bedtime--

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: A warm capper to life as an assassin, hooked on barbiturates.  You were an animal, but we took you in. I gave you a family.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: They're gone now.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: What did you do?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: It's for your own good.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: No. NO it's NOT! You're waiting for me to die!

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: I don't want to fight but we need to talk about these things. There are things.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What things.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Well. Would it be considered nagging if repeated my observation that the dose is too low. To suppress the seizures.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: It's what the guy gave me. I wasn't in a position to make demands.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: I almost died this morning. That seizure was a--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: It wasn't even a minute.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: It felt a lot longer than a minute. I couldn't breathe. I was in a terrible state. You're less affected, Logan-- Please don't give me that look. You know he needs a higher dose. And I know you've got more money squirreled away.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: That money's to get us out of here.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: No. Not us. You and him. You're saving up for a bloody Sunseeker. I don't see myself hiding below deck like Nosferatu, doing laundry, do you? ...Folding your underwear. Making pigs in a blanket.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I don't need this right now.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: A year ago, you asked me to help you. And God knows I try but I can't help you, not really, if you don't talk to me. I hear you at night. You aren't sleeping. You don't want to talk about that. Or the booze you're drinking or the pus you keep wiping from your knuckles or the blood I wash from your clothes or those brand new holes in your chest, that haven't healed. And I very much doubt you want to talk about the fact that you can't read the label on the side of that bottle.  It's Ibuprofen.

Speaker: woman's voice
Dialogue: Senor Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Please. ...We need a ride.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Not available. Call a cab.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I'm not crazy. My name is Gabriela Lopez.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I don't want to know your name!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Anyone can do that job.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: No. It has to be you. I'll give you fifty thousand dollars

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How'd you find me? Huh?! `Cause you are fucking up my life, lady. The people after you are on my ass now.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: ...Sightings... were posted.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Sightings.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: On chat rooms. People said someone looked like The Wolverine was in El Paso, driving. Said he looked old.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: And by people, you mean fat fucktards living in their parents' basements playing with dolls?

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: Whoever it was, they were right.

Speaker: lady manager
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: No. Please. Stop!

Speaker: lady manager
Dialogue: They have to pay for damages. She's got cash. I seen it.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Get your fat ass back in your office. You'll get your money.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: Don't let her call anyone. They will find us. They will kill us.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: I`m a nurse.  Was. In Mexico City.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: When did that happen?

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: This morning. Near the border. I got away from them. But they know my car now.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Where did you get this?

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: It doesn't matter.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Does to me.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: My boyfriend. He wants to kill me. And take her.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: That's your daughter?

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: ...yes.  Please. There won't be any problems. Not if we leave now.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I can't leave right now.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: We have to be there Friday.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Or what?

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: Or we miss our chance. To cross.  Our... family. They will be there that day. No other day.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I can get you there Friday. But I need to go home first, take care of some things.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: Bring us with you. Please. We can help with whatever you need to do.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'll be back in a few hours.  Keep this locked. And tell your mommy I know she's lying.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Tell me you didn't rob a bank.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I got a job that's gonna pay enough to change things. But I have to go away. For a week.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I like those. They make you look younger.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Charles. Listen. I gotta go for a few days. I got a long ride for some good money. When I get back, we're getting out of here, okay. Gonna drive down to Yelapa and get ourselves a boat. Live on the ocean.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: And... you'll be safe there? From the people after you?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yeah. I'll be safe.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Ready to go?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...Fuck.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Hello! Logan! --What happened?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: The job was wrong to begin with.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: I'll close your trunk. --I'm making borscht for Charles if you want some. He got dressed for lunch

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: ...Who does that belong to?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Aren't you supposed to see shit coming?

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: I'm a glorified truffle pig, not a clairvoyant.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Go inside. Keep Charles quiet.  Go. Inside.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: He's been dead for a year.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: I need the girl.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What girl.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: One that goes with that ball you're holding. That's special rubber, you know. Coated with something called J-Tek. Gets in through the skin.  You feel calmer?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: There's no girl here.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: I know you went to the motel.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I was called there. There was no girl. Just the woman.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: "The woman".  That hurts. Say, you didn't shoot the poor thing, did you?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No. Did you?

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: I asked you first.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I don't like guns.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Of course.  I wish you had called me, Logan. Like I asked.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Looks like Ex-military. Maybe a bounty hunter?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Worse.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: He's by himself?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Not for long.  Get him back in his ride. Drive him to the wash and dump him. Then take the car into Juarez, leave it for the vultures.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: What if he wakes up before I get there?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Text me where you are and we'll pick you up.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: You did what you could, Laura.  Well. Yes. Of course, it's painful.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You'll get it back-- after I figure out what you and your mother have got us into.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: That wasn't her mother you met.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: So she talks.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: We're communicating.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We have to go. Leave. It isn't safe here anymore. And you can't have an attack out there. Understand?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: She's the mutant I told you about. The one we have to help.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: She's not a mutant.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Yes, she is.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What's her gift, eating? Pipe throwing?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: It's alright, Laura. It's only a train. A choo choo.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We gotta go.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: You're fucked now, mutey.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: It's alright. It's just another--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: --it's not a train. We gotta go!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Don't be afraid, child. He'll come back for you!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...bloody hell.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: She's not our problem.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I know what you just did.

Speaker: federale commander
Dialogue: Este es el mutante! Capturar o matar!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'm thinking.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: The child, Logan. We mustn't forget Laura. ...Logan...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Please be quiet.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Ah, Charles Xavier. The most wanted octogenarian in North America--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Where's Caliban?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Excuse me. I'm a nonagenarian, actually...

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: How about you tell me where the girl is first. Or maybe I ought to ask the cue ball. Seems friendly.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I told you, she's not here. Where's Caliban?!

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: I left him in the same hole you were going to leave me.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You got extra barbecue tongs for this guy?

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Jesus. Seeing you this way, Wolverine, it breaks my heart.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: As soon as I rip it out of your chest, fuck-stick.

Speaker: federale commander
Dialogue: No one goes in without Federale escort. I am in charge.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: That-a-girl.

Speaker: federale commander
Dialogue: Tomar el mutante!

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Commander, stop!

Speaker: federale commander
Dialogue: You said alive or dead.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Laura! NO! NO!!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...My Lord.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...As I said, Logan, she's a mutant... Like you. Very much like you, in fact.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hold on!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Who the fuck are you?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: You know who she is, Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No. I don't.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Does she remind you of anybody?

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Leave nothing behind fellas. We were not here!

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Wakey wakey.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I believe you're thinking of someone else.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: 'I'm not mistaken, you used to work for my team, for the good guys. You were helping round up all the old mutes.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: I will not. I will not help you.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Of course that's what you'd say. But then I got this theory that people don't really change.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: PLEASE--

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Beware the light.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: I am a nurse and for ten years I have worked at Transigen research in Mexico City.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: They told us they were part of a pharmaceutical study.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Is there more? Play it.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Battery's dead. We need a plug.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: How far is it?  To North Dakota.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Charles.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: You took that woman's money. You told her you would take the child there.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What is she?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: She's your daughter, Logan.  Alkali had your genetic code.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Not just mine.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I don't wanna hear it. I don't want to talk about it anymore.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Stop.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I have to pee.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Last ride. Then we're leaving.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Stop it. For God's sake I can do that myself!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Well, you're not doing it!

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Yo. Girlie. You gotta pay for that.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Not okay.

Speaker: gabriela
Dialogue: As the children became older, they became difficult to control.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...Is this where we're hiding out?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We're not hiding out. We're gonna get a couple hours sleep, clean up, get new clothes, ditch the limo, get a new ride and get the fuck out.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Keep it out front.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Please wait till we're in the room.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: This film is a classic, Laura. Almost a hundred years old now. I first saw it at the Esoldo in Dewsbury when I was your age.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...For fuck's sake.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Who are you guys? More cops? Dude, I already told them everything.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You read this in your spare time?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: --Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Right. Fine.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Good-bye, Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...Fuck.

Speaker: dealer
Dialogue: I know the finish looks beat but it's a `19, got less than sixty on the ody and three hundred horses under the hood. For 10 grand I can get it re-painted for you, fresh tires mounted and balanced, and complete paperwork.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...yeah. Here's the thing. I'll give you twelve as is-- if you can forget the paperwork.

Speaker: dealer
Dialogue: You still need tires, tiger. They're bald.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How long is that gonna take?

Speaker: dealer
Dialogue: Hour, maybe less. If you want, you can get yourself a glass a lunch across the street while you wait.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Jesus Christ...

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You want a refill?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'll take the bottle.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You passing through?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: valet
Dialogue: Sir? Are the keys in it?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Come on, come on!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We have to go.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I'm so sorry. Oh God...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hey! Now!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: This way!

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Get the bodies.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Knock it off.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: She's a child, Logan. In point of fact she's--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How long has it been since you took your meds?  Charles. How long?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...I don't know. Two days.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You saw what happened last night. If that shit had gone on longer, everyone at that casino--

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I did what I had to do to stop those men from taking Laura.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You didn't do anything. You freaked out and had a fucking seizure.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I guess you prefer me pharmaceutically castrated, rambling on like some lunatic. So much easier on you.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Easier? There's nothing easy about you.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Yes, Yes please, be like the rest of the world and blame someone else for your boring shit.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yeah, I know, Pop, I'm such a giant DISAPPOINTMENT--

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Self loathing. Anger. Disdain. Cowardice. Oh yes. Your peaks and your valleys. Mostly valleys-- it's all so Goddamn boring.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What are we doing?!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: There is a young mutant. Sitting in our car.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yes. It means nothing to me. Especially since Nurse Gabriela made all this Eden shit up from fucking comic books.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Give those to him. Take out two and give them to him.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: What do you mean--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Now. For fuck's sake. Take the pills. Now.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Logan.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Take them.  Give him the pills.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: LOGAN --

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: --GIVE HIM THE FUCKING PILLS!

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Happy?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Cop. Fuck.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: What does he want?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: She. I might have been speeding.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Are you sure that's all it is?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: If it wasn't, there'd be a lot more than her behind us.  I need you to please try and not kill this lady. Okay?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Was I going a mite fast, officer?

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: License and registration, please.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I just bought it, but I-- here--

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Any idea just how "mite" fast you were going, Mr... Howlett?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Seventy? Ish?

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Try ninety six.  Ish.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Shit. I didn't think this thing could make that.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: You're not from round here. It's harvest season. You need to be more careful. This your daughter?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yes, ma'am.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: What's your name, honey?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: She doesn't speak.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: But she does have a name.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Laura.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: That your name, honey?  And is this man your father?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: My son has a bit of a lead foot. I try to tell him that Mount Rushmore will still be there and just as beautiful a day from now.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: You got a nice family. Try to keep `em safe, James.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: HEY--

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Language, Logan. And you're screaming at a machine.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What, she can gut a man with her feet, but she can't hear naughty words?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: She can learn to be better.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You mean, better than me.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Actually, yes. And by the way, Laura's foot claws are an obvious result of her gender.  In a pride of lions, females are caregivers of the young and hunters of the pride, they have front claws to hunt and foot claws for defense. They use the foot claw to strike the belly or bladder of the attacker, thus ensuring their escape and survival.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Shit. Oh well.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: We have to help them.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We have to keep moving. Someone will come along.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Someone has come along.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Nate! Get off the road!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Can I give you a hand?

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Sure. Thank you.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Nate.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: What.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: James. Howlett.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Thank you so much for your help, sir. I'm Kathryn, and this our son, Nate.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yeah. That's Laura.  Chuck.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Where you all headed?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: North.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Can we at least give the three of you a decent meal, show our appreciation? We don't live far from here.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: That would be lovely.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No, thank you, we really can't--  Laura, get back here.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Please. It's the least we can do. And you're going to have to stop for dinner somewhere.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Please let me be...

Speaker: red-haired man
Dialogue: I'm offering an opportunity, Caliban. To redeem yourself, to protect the world, and, in the process, save your friends.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: What do you want from me?! I did what I could and your human toaster ovens fucked it all up.

Speaker: red-haired man
Dialogue: I agree the Reavers have not been effective. I'm bringing new tools to bear. But I still need someone to point us in the right direction.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: No, no, no. I can't keep--

Speaker: red-haired man
Dialogue: Breathe. Breathe. What does he have, the old man, your friend? Alzheimer's? ALS? A degenerative brain disease in the world's most dangerous brain. What a combo.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: We thank you, Lord, for this food... and we also thank you, Lord, for sending our new friends, the Howletts to our aid today. Amen.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Slow down, child.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: There's plenty more if you want.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Where are you all heading?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Oregon.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: South Dakota.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Vacation?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Yes. Long overdue. We're city folk. Always wanted to take a road trip, see the country.  Meet the people who live in it.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: That sounds lovely. I've been trying to get Will here to take a vacation for years now.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: And if we go out traipsing around the country, who's gonna take care of this place?

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Exactly. I say, let it go.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: And live off what?

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: The Lord will provide.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Well, I'm still waiting for him to provide me with a new thresher.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: All the same, I'd love to travel someday.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: And I bet you will.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I could drop out of school.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Let's not go that far.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: Kathryn, that was easily the best meatloaf I've ever had.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Thank you, Chuck.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Oh. I uh, I--

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Kathryn.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: What? It's a natural thing to ask.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: He was. She passed.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Oh, I'm so sorry.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: He killed her.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Ma'am, I can't thank you enough for dinner. But we have a long drive ahead of us.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: You need to rest, don't you?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: We'll find a motel.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Nearest is two hours from here and it's not very--

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: They're gonna stay here. We have a perfectly fine room upstairs for your daughter and father and you can sleep in the living room on the convertible.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Kathryn. That's very nice of you, but we really should hit the--

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: We could leave first thing in the morning. Crack of dawn as it were.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Let's go wash up, Pop.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: --two days on the road with one meal and hardly any sleep. She's eleven and I'm fucking ninety.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: That's a hundred and one reasons to keep moving.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I'm not a box of avocados.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: And then what. We stay the night and then what?

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: We take Laura to her friends in Eden and then... then we buy that Sunseeker.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Nate, go fill up the tub before we lose pressure.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: They shut it off again.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Who's "they?"

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: You best deal with it now.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: It can wait till morning. We got rain last night.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Will. We have three guests in this house and sink full of dishes.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Alright. You're right.  The pump station that supplies us is a mile and a half from here. Sometimes it gets itself shut off.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: By assholes.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: My son can go with you.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Oh, no. Thank you. But these men who did this, they can be--

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I'll come.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: No. You have homework.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'll go.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: There's a TV in here.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Okay... Get some rest.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: You know, Logan. This is what life looks like. A house, people who love each other. A safe place. Take a moment and feel it.  You still have time.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Charles. The world is not the same as it was. We're taking a risk here. And where we're going. Eden. It doesn't exist. Her nurse got it from a comic book.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: It is for Laura.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Don't worry. We won't need it.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Canewood Beverage bought up everything out here. Except us. When we wouldn't sell, they tried eminent domain. Then screwing with our water. Couple months ago, someone poisoned our dogs.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: So today, out on the highway--

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Who knows. Maybe.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: So why do people eat it?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: They don't. They drink it.  Corn syrup. Its in all those drugged up drinks everyone's having nowadays-- to stay awake, feel strong, cheer up, sexy, whatever. Used to be a time when a bad day was just a bad day, you know?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Mine still are.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Looks like we'll be here a while.

Speaker: nate
Dialogue: I'm not too good at math.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: How long's your girl been that way?  Mute.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Since... well.. the beginning.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Some ways I envy you. They get to be Nate's age, the nonsense that comes out their mouth. Makes you question the point of it all.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You're a lucky man.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: I guess I am.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: That should hold it.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Until the next time.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Don't know why I bother.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: Evening, Mr. Munson.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Why don't you ask your boys?

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: You understand, you're trespassing right now, right?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: I have an easement with the previous owner of your property.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: Previous being the operative word.  Who's this?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I'm nobody. Just a guy telling you to get back in your nice truck and play Okie dickhead somewhere else.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: You hire some muscle, Mr. Munson?

Speaker: will
Dialogue: He's a friend of mine.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: A friend with a big mouth.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I hear that a lot.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: Then you probably hear this, too.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: More than I'd like.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: Then you know the drill. I'm gonna count to three and you are gonna start walking away.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: I got rights to this water --

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: One.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: And I have a lawyer now--

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: TWO--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Three.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: You've had training.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Some.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Wish I had you around all the time.  Sure you don't want to stay?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No, but I'll take a drink if you got one.

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Kathryn doesn't like booze in the house.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Maybe I got something in the truck.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...Don't wake her yet. Let her have another hour.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Your baby boy just took out the most wanted mutey in the world.

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: You said you wanted the girl! You said you just wanted the girl!

Speaker: will
Dialogue: Since Nate was born, I try not to imbibe much. Maybe once a month.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Only on days that end in "Y."

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Put her down.

Speaker: kathryn
Dialogue: Stay down there, Will!

Speaker: reaver driver
Dialogue: I'll pick em up -- meet em halfway. Let the clean up crew in.

Speaker: rice
Dialogue: We learned the hard way with the X-23's. We assumed, because they were children, their emotional responses could be manipulated. But you can't nurture rage. You must simply design it.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Who the fuck is that?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You need to keep this around you. Charles. Listen, you need--

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: Come out here now, Munson!

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: I don't know what Munson's paying you, but I'm willing to let bygones be bygones. We could start you at 5G. A week that is.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: You're the one he listens to, Doc.

Speaker: charles
Dialogue: ...our boat... ...our Eden...

Speaker: caliban
Dialogue: Beware the light.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hold still! Stop it! Stop!

Speaker: rice
Dialogue: You did fine, twenty four. Breathe. You're healing. You did well. You're a newborn by any measure. Just breathe. Your body has work to do. Hemostasis, angiogenesis, epithelialization, stromal cell proliferation -- Here. This will help with the pain.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Well. It's got water and... it's...

Speaker: old doctor
Dialogue: Welcome back. I was starting to think I was gonna have to tell that nice little girl out in the waiting room that her daddy's gone.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...Nice to meet you too, Doc, but I need to get on my--

Speaker: old doctor
Dialogue: What you need is rest... and treatment. You need to check yourself in somewhere and--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: --I'm alright. I'm fine.

Speaker: old doctor
Dialogue: No. You're not. I mean, I know you're different. But that doesn't change the fact that something inside you is poisoning you. You need to check yourself into a hospital and run some tests, find out what it is.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...I know what it is.

Speaker: old doctor
Dialogue: Please. Mister. If you don't want to go to a hospital, maybe I can--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: --Doc. Look at me. You seem like a nice man. But you wanna save a life? Save yours. And everyone else's in this place. Let us get on our way.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You can't just take shit, you know.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Look. I don't know how you got me here,.. but thank you.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: De nada.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...You can talk?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You can talk.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What the fuck?! Why haven't you-- What's all this bullshit been for the last two thousand miles of--

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Tu espera que hable con tu cuando no mirarme? Tu espera que hable con tu cuando me insultas y tratar de dejarme atrs!?--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: SHUT THE FUCK UP!!!

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Jonah, Gideon, Rebecca, Delilah and Rictor.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Who is that?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: North Dakota.  Jonah, Gideon, Rebecca, Delilah and Rictor.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Okay. Look. This place. Your mom... she read too many... stories.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Si, Eden, por favor.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: --those are the names of the people who made up these stories. Something happened once and these people made it into a big lie...

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Le pagaron me llevo a este lugar! Por qu no puedes llevarme a este lugar!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yes, I know. It's a long way.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Jonah, Gideon, Rebecca, Delilah and Rictor.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Stop saying those names--

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Vaminos!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Do. Not. Hit. Me.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Jonah, Gideon--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: --And stop saying those--

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: --Rebecca, Delilah and Rictor.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Okay-- ENOUGH. Enough.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: That ain't a torx, honey. That's a phillips head. I need a torx.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: This? Or this. They look the same.

Speaker: military nurse
Dialogue: Wow. Responsive.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: military nurse
Dialogue: Your hand. Its amazing.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Get the fuck out of here. This shit's classified.

Speaker: major
Dialogue: --and we understand the importance of containment, Dr Rice. But we are in the continental United States.

Speaker: major
Dialogue: We appreciate that but you can't just leave a war zone behind like you, like you did in Juarez. We--

Speaker: major
Dialogue: Not all.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Look at that. Was found at the farmhouse. I know. It's her. But look at the other side.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Wh-what more do you want from me?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Let me drive.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No. Absolutely not.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You're dying.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: No comprende.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You are dying.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What else did he tell you?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: To not let you.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Rest.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Come! Come!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Where am I?

Speaker: lizard boy
Dialogue: Is this good, Rictor?

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Not so much. Less.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Where did you get this?!

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Where we come from.  They gave it to us when we fight. It makes you stronger.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: It makes you crazy is what it does. It'll kill you.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Not in small doses.  It's helping you heal, man.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Where's Laura.

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: She's asleep. Do you want me to wake her up?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Pesadillas. ...you had night-mare.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Do you have nightmares?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: ...People hurt me.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Mine are different.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Por que?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I hurt people.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You know what it is.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I've hurt people too.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You're gonna have to learn how to live with that.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: They were bad people.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: All the same.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Jonah! Stop! STOP!

Speaker: lizard boy
Dialogue: Jonah, let go! Now!

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Cut the shit.

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: ...Was Sabretooth real?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: What.

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: Laura said you said all the stories in the comic books were lies.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Not all. Not completely. Sabretooth was real. He was in a program with me. Like what they did to you.

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: So you did mean things with him.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: But now you're doing good things.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Kid, I don't know what I'm doing.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Not funny. Not funny at all.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: What.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: How long have I been in that bed?

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Two days.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: You've been sitting here two days? You can't do that. You can't just stay here forever.

Speaker: other kid
Dialogue: We aren't. We had to wait. It was the plan. Everyone had `til today to find their way here.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Well, if you keep waiting those assholes will find you. And kill you all. You need to get out.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: What do you think we're doing, asshole? We're leaving tomorrow at dawn. We're going to cross the border.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: To Canada?

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Si.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: That was the signal. They're ready for us on the other side.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Okay. Good.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: ...Come with me.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Keep it. For your supplies or whatever.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: She says it's yours.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yeah. Well. Look. I don't need this. You do. For supplies. Buy her some cereal.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: They seem nice. Your friends.  Kinda remind me--

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: And where will you go?

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Nearest bar, for starters.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Such a nice man.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Hey, I never asked for this.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Then I will be fine.

Speaker: lizard boy
Dialogue: Ow.

Speaker: rice
Dialogue: Move faster. We can't let them get to the border.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Ella! Run faster! Run!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Laura! Now!

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You took all the medicine.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Go to your friends, Laura.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Green juice is wearing down, huh? For an ol' mute, that a short high. Gonna be hard to keep those claws out soon.

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Waste this dick, Logan!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: He's the asshole who put this poison in me.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: I think I might have killed him.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Shit. Show some respect, mutey. You're lookin' at the man who wiped out your kind.

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Growing mutants of your own.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: Dangerous times, James. We can't trust fate to--

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Yeah. Dangerous.

Speaker: pierce
Dialogue: It's showtime, boy!

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Laura! No!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Laura...

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: Laura!

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Laura. You need to get out.  All of you. Get out of here! Now!

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: Go, go GO! Run!

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: no, no, no...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: ...Take your friends and run. Go. Listen to me, Laura. Run. They'll just keep coming and coming.  ...Don't be what they made you.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: No... ...daddy...

Speaker: logan
Dialogue: So this is what it feels like.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: There's no living with a killing. There's no going back. Right or wrong, it's a brand. A brand that sticks. Now run on home to your mother, and tell her everything's alright. There's no more guns in the valley...

Speaker: rictor
Dialogue: We gotta go.
